title: 100 New Public E-charging Stations Nationwide
text:
100 New Public E-charging Stations Nationwide
More than 100 new public e-charging stations outside the capital can be established nationwide, thanks to a HUF 28 billion subsidy opportunity scheduled to open in August, the Ministry of Energy Affairs announced in a statement on its Facebook page.
The program launched for social consultation also encourages the installation of modern charging points equipped with solar panels and energy storage.
"Hungary is striving for a leading role in its production and storage in homes, industrial sites and also in vehicles," the post reads.
"Electric cars can be used without air pollution, they are quieter than those powered by an internal combustion engine, and their operators can save on operating and maintenance costs.
The related job-creating industrial developments promote the restoration of economic growth and the strengthening of competitiveness," the ministry said.
